page.title: 01Mawdesley and Eccleston
page.content: This rural area has a long recorded history.The village of Mawdesley existed as early as 1288. Until very recently it was well-known for basket-making,the willow twigs grown in the area being particularly well-suited to this craft. As its name suggests,there has been a church in Eccleston for many centuries,the earliest record of it being 1094. The area is very flat,nearby Harrock Hill providing a panoramic view of it.The soil is heavy clay,and so it is mainly intensively farmed grassland. The Delph,a former quarry now water-filled,is a popular site for camping and picnics,and is used by sub-aqua clubs.
